headline: Dollar Tree's sale of Family Dollar marks a return to roots
summary: Dollar Tree (DLTR) is selling its Family Dollar business for $1 billion to private equity firms as a strategic shift to refocus on its core operations. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma joins Market Domination hosts Josh Lipton and Julie Hyman to discuss the sale and positive investor reactions, as well as the ways Dollar Tree is mitigating challenges from tariffs and ongoing market pressures.

headline: Why Are Dollar Tree (DLTR) Shares Soaring Today
summary: Shares of discount treasure-hunt retailer Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) jumped 8% in the morning session after the company reported fourth-quarter 2024 financial results, which don't matter as much as the announcement to sell the Family Dollar unit (a costly experiment that struggled to generate profits) for roughly $1 billion. This is a far cry from the $8.5 billion the company coughed up to acquire the business in 2015.

This is a far cry from the $8.5 billion the company coughed up to acquire the business in 2015.

headline: Nvidia, GameStop, Dollar Tree: Market Minute

Nvidia (NVDA) shares are falling following a Financial Times report that the company's sales in China could be hit by new environmental rules. Share of GameStop (GME) are soaring after announcing it was going to start buying bitcoin as a reserve asset. Dollar Tree (DLTR) shares are also on the rise after revealing it will sell its Family Dollar business for about $1 billion. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Nvidia, Tesla, Dollar Tree, Chewy, GameStop, Nintendo: Stocks to watch
summary: U.S. stocks were mixed on Wednesday after data showed core durable goods orders contracted in February. The tech heavy Nasdaq Composite index fell about 0.9% as of 10 a.m. EDT, the S&P 500 dropped 0.3%, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average added about 129 points. Tesla (TSLA) and Nvidia (NVDA) fell by 3.3% and 3.6%, respectively.

headline: Dollar Tree to Sell Family Dollar Chain for $1 Billion. The Stock Is Jumping.
summary: Discount retailer  Dollar Tree  announced a deal Wednesday to sell its Family Dollar business to two private-equity firms for $1 billion, alongside fourth-quarter earnings that beat expectations.  The company acquired Family Dollar for around $9 billion in 2015 but the unit has struggled.  The retailer last year said it would close almost 1,000 Family Dollar stores, before launching a strategic review into the business.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree to Sell Family Dollar Chain for $1 Billion. The Stock Is Jumping.

The company acquired Family Dollar for around $9 billion in 2015 but the unit has struggled.  The retailer last year said it would close almost 1,000 Family Dollar stores, before launching a strategic review into the business.

headline: Dollar Tree sells Family Dollar to private equity firms after a decade of trying to find a fit
summary: Dollar Tree is selling Family Dollar to a pair of private equity firms for $1 billion after a decade of trying to make its acquisition of the bargain chain fit.  Dollar Tree Inc. acquired Family Dollar for more than $8 billion in 2015 after a bidding war with rival Dollar General.  Dollar Tree last year announced that it planned to close hundreds of Family Dollar stores.

headline: Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) Misses Q4 Sales Targets, But Stock Soars 7.2%
summary: Discount treasure-hunt retailer Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2024, with sales falling 42.1% year on year to $5 billion. Next quarter’s revenue guidance of $4.55 billion underwhelmed, coming in 42.1% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.29 per share was 4.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) Misses Q4 Sales Targets, But Stock Soars 7.2%

headline: Dollar Tree Announces Agreement to Divest Its Family Dollar Business to Brigade Capital Management and Macellum Capital Management
summary: CHESAPEAKE, Va., March 26, 2025--Dollar Tree, Inc. (NASDAQ: DLTR) today announced that the Company has reached an agreement under which Brigade Capital Management, LP ("Brigade") and Macellum Capital Management, LLC ("Macellum") will partner to acquire the Company’s Family Dollar business segment. Family Dollar will remain headquartered in Chesapeake, Virginia.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree Announces Agreement to Divest Its Family Dollar Business to Brigade Capital Management and Macellum Capital Management
raw.summary: CHESAPEAKE, Va., March 26, 2025--Dollar Tree, Inc. (NASDAQ: DLTR) today announced that the Company has reached an agreement under which Brigade Capital Management, LP ("Brigade") and Macellum Capital Management, LLC ("Macellum") will partner to acquire the Company’s Family Dollar business segment. Family Dollar will remain headquartered in Chesapeake, Virginia.

headline: Dollar Tree offloads struggling Family Dollar chain for $1 billion
summary: The 66-year-old business, which Dollar Tree bought in 2015 for about $9 billion, had been grappling with competition from big-box retailers such as Walmart, and online retailers including Amazon, Shein and Temu.  Shares of Dollar Tree were up 6% in premarket trading after the news of the sale to Brigade Capital Management and Macellum Capital Management.  The Family Dollar chain struggled particularly with sales of higher-margin discretionary items such as home decor and apparel as lower-income consumers, earning about $50,000 a year, pared back spending in the face of higher inflation.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree offloads struggling Family Dollar chain for $1 billion
raw.summary: The 66-year-old business, which Dollar Tree bought in 2015 for about $9 billion, had been grappling with competition from big-box retailers such as Walmart, and online retailers including Amazon, Shein and Temu.  Shares of Dollar Tree were up 6% in premarket trading after the news of the sale to Brigade Capital Management and Macellum Capital Management.  The Family Dollar chain struggled particularly with sales of higher-margin discretionary items such as home decor and apparel as lower-income consumers, earning about $50,000 a year, pared back spending in the face of higher inflation.

headline: Dollar Tree to Sell Family Dollar Business for $1 Billion
summary: Dollar Tree  is nearing a sale of its Family Dollar business to a consortium of private-equity investors for roughly $1 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.  The discount-retail chain is set to be acquired by Brigade Capital Management and Macellum Capital Management, the people said.  A deal is expected to be announced later Wednesday morning, when Dollar Tree reports its quarterly results, they added.

A deal is expected to be announced later Wednesday morning, when Dollar Tree reports its quarterly results, they added.
